techmeme.title: Popular photo editing company Pixelmator says it has signed an agreement to be acquired by Apple, pending regulatory approval (Chance Miller/9to5Mac)
A profile of YC Head of Public Policy Luther Lowe, who led a California pressure campaign against AI safety bill SB 1047 and aims to fight for "little tech" (Sarah McBride/Bloomberg)
Satellite services provider Globalstar says Apple took a 20% ownership stake worth ~$400M, and has committed another $1.1B to expand satellite service capacity (Benjamin Mayo/9to5Mac)
The capital expenditures of Amazon, Alphabet, Meta, and Microsoft are set to total over $200B in 2024, as companies accelerate spending to chase AI developments (Bloomberg)
Canalys: global smartphone shipments grew 5% YoY in Q3 to 309.9M units, the strongest Q3 since 2021; Samsung led with 57.5M units, followed by Apple at 54.5M (Canalys)
